itemDescription: English geographer, writer and soldier; surveyed the Indian frontier, and Chilean-Argentine border

wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Sir Thomas Hungerford Holdich  (13 February 1843 – 2 November 1929) was an English geographer and president of the Royal Geographical Society. He is best known as Superintendent of Frontier Surveys in British India and author of numerous books, including The Gates of India, The Countries of the King's Award and Political Frontiers and Boundary Making.
